meanings.definition: The arrival or entry of a large number of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The influx of tourists during the summer boosted the local economy.
meanings.sent2: The city experienced an influx of new residents after the job market improved.
meanings.sent3: The sudden influx of puppies at the animal shelter led to a shortage of dog food.
meanings.sent4: The influx of ideas during brainstorming sessions can lead to innovative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The influx of donations helped the charity provide more support to those in need.

meanings.sent1: The influx of water into the reservoir filled it to capacity.
meanings.sent2: The influx of air through the open window cooled down the room.
meanings.sent3: The influx of customers into the store caused a rush at the checkout counter.
meanings.sent4: The influx of sunlight through the window brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The influx of colors in the painting created a vibrant and lively composition.
